com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface Display

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseDisplay
public interface Display

This class implements an off-screen rendering surface. A Display has an offscreen Image buffer - with an associated map coordinates Envelope. You can set or get the Envelope using the setExtent() and getExtent() methods. When you specify an Envelope with the setExtent() method, a Display will automatically modify the aspect ratio of your envelope to match that of the Image size. The modification will ensure that the new Envelope has the same center and scale.

Data can normally bre rendered into a Display by obtaining a DisplayArea using the createDisplayArea() method.

In order to be able to create the offscreen Image, you can supply an OSBFactory object that supplies a createImage(w,h) method. Typically this will just be a visual Component - com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.Map passes a reference to itself - however, for non-visual applications, such as server-side Map Renderers, you will need to specify an object that creates a JDK 1.2 BufferedImage.

See Also:
OSBFactory

Method Detail

getImage

public BufferedImage getImage()
Returns the current rendering image. Note that this image may be frequently changed.

Returns:
the image

createDisplayArea

public DisplayArea createDisplayArea(Envelope envelope,
                                     CoordinateSystem coordSys)
Creates a DisplayArea for the given Envelope.

Parameters:
envelope - a world coordinates area intersecting with the Display's Extent
coordSys - the coordinate system of the envelope
Returns:
a new DisplayArea

getDisplayAreas

public Iterator getDisplayAreas()
Returns all DisplayAreas that are currently rendering into this Display. The result of each call to the next() method of the Iterator returned can be cast to a DisplayArea object.

Returns:
an Iterator that references the DisplayAreas

getRenderingHints

public RenderingHints getRenderingHints()
Returns the RenderingHints associated with the display

Returns:
rendering hints
See Also:
setRenderingHints(java.awt.RenderingHints), Graphics2D.setRenderingHints(java.util.Map)

setRenderingHints

public void setRenderingHints(RenderingHints hints)
Sets the given RenderingHints object to the rendering of this Display. You can cancel previous RenderingHints by specifying null. When the value of RenderingHints is set to null, then the default from a Graphics2D object applies.

Parameters:
hints - the rendering hints
See Also:
Graphics2D.setRenderingHints(java.util.Map)

draw

                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height)
Paints the Display into the given area of a graphics context.

Parameters:
g - the graphics context
x - the X ordinate
y - the Y ordinate
width - the width of the display
height - the height of the display

setOSBFactory

public void setOSBFactory(OSBFactory o)
Sets the OSBFactory object that can create images. You don't need to call this method, but by default, opaque images are normally expected to be created using BufferedImage TYPE_INT_RGB. You would need to supply another OSBFactory if you wanted transparent images.

Parameters:
o - the OSBFactory to use
See Also:
OSBFactory

getOSBFactory

public OSBFactory getOSBFactory()
Returns the OSBFactory object that create images.

Returns:
the OSBFactory
See Also:
OSBFactory

getExtent

public Envelope getExtent()
Returns a copy of the current map extent.

Returns:
the map extent

setExtent

public void setExtent(Envelope x)
Sets the current map extent. The extent will be modified so that it has the same aspect ratio as the Display image size.

Parameters:
x - the new extent

getBackground

public Color getBackground()
Returns the current background color.

Returns:
the background color

setBackground

public void setBackground(Color c)
Sets the current background color. The specified color will be used to fill in the Display background whenever the Display size is altered via setSize().

Parameters:
c - the new background color
See Also:
setSize(int, int)

getSize

public Dimension getSize()
Returns the Display image size.

Returns:
the image size

setSize

public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
Sets the Display image size and create a new buffered image. You typically invoke this method when the Display's container changes size. You must invoke this method at least once, in order to create the initial image for rendering purposes. Even if the width and height are the same as the existing width and height, a new image will be created. The Extent property is not changed by calling this method - you must adjust the Extent using setExtent() as appropriate

Parameters:
width - the new display width
height - the new display height

setSize

public void setSize(int width,
                    int height,
                    boolean flush)
Normally, when setSize(int,int) creates a new bufferedImage, the old image is immediately flush()ed; Use this method to avoid flushing the old image, for example, if you call getImage() just before calling setSize(). If you pass "false" to this method, then it is your responsibility to flush() the old image, otherwise memory resources used by the image may not be cleaned away when it is GC'ed

Parameters:
width - the new display width
height - the new display height
flush - true == flush the old image, false == otherwise
See Also:
setSize(int,int), Image.flush()

getTransform

public Transform getTransform()
Returns the current world-to-screen coordinates transformation.

Returns:
the transform

getInverseTransform

public Transform getInverseTransform()
Returns the current screen-to-world coordinates transform.

Returns:
the inverse transform

clear

public void clear(Envelope a)
Clears an area of the Display surface, that is, it paints it with the background color.

Parameters:
a - the Envelope to be cleared
